p: Isoprene derivatives, flavonoids, glucosinolates and other plant metabolites may affect the physiological and chemical function of the digestive tract. The stabilizing effect on intestinal microbiota may be associated with intermediate nutrient metabolism (Baratta, Dorman, Deans, Biondi, & Ruberto, 1998; Horton, Fennell, & Prasad, 1991; Jamroz et al., 2003). The pharmacological action of active plant substances or herbal extracts in humans is well‐known, but in animal nutrition the number of precise experiments is relatively low.
